etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Cycas, Cycad- (order name), from supposed Greek kukas, scribal error for koikas, plural of koix ‘Egyptian palm’

definitions: a palmlike plant of tropical and subtropical regions, bearing large male or female cones. Cycads were abundant during the Triassic and Jurassic eras, but have since been in decline.

notes.text: Class Cycadopsida, subdivision Gymnospermae: twenty species in the genus Cycas and family Cycadaceae

shortDefinitions: palmlike plant of tropical and subtropical regions
